intro: Leptopleuria, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their tall, erect stems and showy, often fragrant flowers. They typically grow in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Leptopleuria species are native to various regions in the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. Their botanical features include strap-like leaves and specialized orchid flowers with intricate structures adapted for pollination.
